intro: Vogelia arabica, commonly known as the Arabian coffee plant, is a flowering shrub native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of white, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used to make coffee. Vogelia arabica thrives in arid and semi-arid climates, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its historical significance in coffee production, it holds cultural and economic importance in the region.
